body_html:
TF_EXPORT sounds good!
…
On Mar 8, 2017 4:40 PM, "guschmue" ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In tensorflow/core/framework/types.h <#8217 (comment)> : > @@ -68,9 +68,17 @@ class DeviceType { std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const DeviceType& d); // Convenient constants that can be passed to a DeviceType constructor -extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU; // "CPU" -extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU; // "GPU" -extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL; // "SYCL" +#if !defined(TF_EXTERN) Like it. Want to call it TF_DLLEXPORT or TF_EXPORT ? Later might be nicer if you want to control visibility on linux. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8217 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbcUFjNUYjirlXtZ97Q_-jLhrPdsgks5rj0pygaJpZM4MXVGg> .
body_text:
TF_EXPORT sounds good!
…
On Mar 8, 2017 4:40 PM, "guschmue" ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In tensorflow/core/framework/types.h
 <#8217 (comment)>
 :

 > @@ -68,9 +68,17 @@ class DeviceType {
  std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const DeviceType& d);

  // Convenient constants that can be passed to a DeviceType constructor
 -extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU;   // "CPU"
 -extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU;   // "GPU"
 -extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL;  // "SYCL"
 +#if !defined(TF_EXTERN)

 Like it. Want to call it TF_DLLEXPORT or TF_EXPORT ? Later might be nicer
 if you want to control visibility on linux.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#8217 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbcUFjNUYjirlXtZ97Q_-jLhrPdsgks5rj0pygaJpZM4MXVGg>
 .
body:
TF_EXPORT sounds good!

On Mar 8, 2017 4:40 PM, "guschmue" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@guschmue* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In tensorflow/core/framework/types.h
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/8217#discussion_r105061992>
> :
>
> > @@ -68,9 +68,17 @@ class DeviceType {
>  std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const DeviceType& d);
>
>  // Convenient constants that can be passed to a DeviceType constructor
> -extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU;   // "CPU"
> -extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU;   // "GPU"
> -extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL;  // "SYCL"
> +#if !defined(TF_EXTERN)
>
> Like it. Want to call it TF_DLLEXPORT or TF_EXPORT ? Later might be nicer
> if you want to control visibility on linux.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/8217#discussion_r105061992>,
> or mute the thread

> .
